37806764.review:
Funny physics based skilift/bridge building game. 
As with most of these types of games it features simple physics, compression/tension stress and inertia.
What really makes this game stand out is the above average production quality, fun level designs and completely free camera control. There's also a variation of 3 different types of level objectives which are mixing things up from time to time.
Overall pretty decent casual game, perfect for taking a break from work or other things.

I saw it in YouTube, played it for a while, but got bored. I think it’s a good game, but it didn’t manage to hold my attention for long enough to get a lot of enjoyment from it. I would give it a 5/10.

36427945.review:
[quote][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11769719/]Больше качественных и интересных обзоров на кураторской страничке Dreams of Genesis.[/url][/quote]

[h1]Канатная дорога в небеса[/h1]

[b]Все любят аркады. Даже самые заядлые хардкорщики любят аркады. Одним из самых распространённых видов аркад является постройка чего-либо. Самым известным представителем такого поджанра, как по мне, является постройка мостов. Разработчики Carried Away решили изменить сеттинг, но не трогать общую концепцию. Получилось довольно таки неплохо.   [/b]

Итак, в течение всего прохождения Carried Away нам придётся строить канатную дорогу для лыжников. Да, вот так вот решили изменить сеттинг и выглядит всё в этой игре просто великолепно. Всё дело в картинке и стилистике: милая мультяшная картинка, яркие пейзажи, много деталей и буйство красок. За происходящим на экране очень приятно наблюдать. Особенно после того, как дорога достроена и по ней начинают ехать лыжники. Можно приближать камеру, вертеть ею по кругу и под любым углом рассматривать плоды своего труда. 

Игровой процесс довольно таки интересный. Конечно, практически каждый геймер хоть раз строил мосты в подобных аркадах. Здесь нет практически ничего нового, но вот то, как подаётся старое – заслуживает отдельного внимания. Игра раскрывается постепенно, и это подкупает больше всего. Сначала перед нами открывают дверь в обучающий режим, где нам покажут основы строительства, в шутливой форме будут объяснять, какая деталь для чего нужна и как тут всё работает, и лишь продемонстрировав все возможности пустят нас на самотёк. И вот когда мы уже начинаем что-то делать без подсказок – начинается хардкор, от которого невольно начинаешь получать удовольствие. На первых уровнях вы ещё чувствуете себя крутым, без труда строя нужную дорогу, но чем дальше – тем труднее. И в одним прекрасный момент вы просто сталкиваетесь с задачкой, которая не поддается вам с первого раза. И в такие моменты понимаешь: а эта маленькая штучка не так уж и проста. 

Порадовало наличие добротного русского перевода. Не столько из-за пояснения основ игрового процесса, сколько из-за реплик мастера стройки, который то и дело отпускает какие-то шутки, которые невольно заставляют улыбаться. С оптимизацией всё в полном порядке, багов и проседаний нету, всё работает корректно. Музыкально сопровождение приятное и отлично дополняет происходящее на экране. 

Это добротная игра, которая ,увы, придётся по вкусу не всем. Если вы любите подобные аркады и построили в своё время не один мост, то я бы рекомендовал вам обратить внимание на данную игру. Для вас она может оказаться маленьким шедевром. Если же вы никогда не пробовали себя в этом жанре, то я думаю, что вы не потеряете ничего, приобретя данный проект. Он стоит затраченного на него времени. 

[h1]Общая оценка: 7/10[/h1]

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1264342058

This game carried me away to a place i never been before, a magical place more magical thaen my basement. Very realistic, just like i rembered it in the skislopes of Sweden. I'm a professional Snowboarder and skier and i can solely confirm that this game is 100% autentic.

This is no rip off of that bridge poly game, this is on a completely diffrent level. Btw, we need more levels.

I watched Robbaz play this game and dman is he smart and handssome. He sovled all the maps on the first try. Chat wwas very much amazed by his utter amazing skills. Chad even gave it a 86% approval, very gut! Robert did espacially not try to solve one of those maps in a just under a hour. That's fake news.

Haven't tried the community levels just yet, but i bet you they are probably smashing.

The music was also outa this world. Very impresssive. Would listen again.

- Robert & Chad

35934458.review: a very good game no lag! very good for people that like building

35869583.review:
[h1]A newer (meaning a little less polished) PolyBridge in the mountain.[/h1]

There's room for improvement, but good quality game already though, don't get me wrong.

[b]If you like PolyBridge, there's no reason for you not to like Carried Away.[/b]

Carried Away also adds interesting little twists like allowing you to control the skiers on some levels, and you don't always have to build lift towers, sometimes it's jumps. It breaks the monotony a little bit.

Really like where this game is going, and not the kind of early access release where you just get a dev build of a sh*tty project someone did on it's spare time. This is an actual game, and it's worth it's price.

35834867.review:
[FR]
Tout simplement une pure merveille.
Je ne joue que très rarement a ce genre de petit jeu, donc, j'ai voulu essayer par curiosité et là... 
Impossible de m'arrêter, je veux construire plus gros, plus grand, et surtout avec plus d'ingéniosité !!

35614181.review: Fantastic, brain teasing game. Several levels require unique and inovative ideas to solve and do give your brain a work out. 10/10

35611410.review:
This is an early access game?  Honestly when I bought it, I hadn't paid attention.  The quality and fun this game provides feels like a finished product that I'm already delighted to own.  While you only build the one thing (ski lifts) the challenging physics and local terrain make every build a work of ingenuity that feels oh so satisfying to finally complete.  And with the Steam Workshop allowing for community-made maps, I'll likely never run out of content for the life of the game!

One of the things I personally adore is the fact that there are no requirements to advance other than to complete the level.  There are medals in the game to encourage you to do certain things (like build under budget), but the game never forces you to work for them or tries to gate later content behind having enough of them.  Don't want to care about the budget?  Spend to your hearts' content.  Feel like the extra challenge is worth it?  Then you can try to get number 1 on the leaderboards!  It allows everyone to go at their own pace and their own challenge level.

Very relaxing, tons of fun, and failure is part of the hilarity.  I highly recommend picking this up if you enjoy puzzle builders, or just want a good time in general.

35608532.review: Great Indie Game!! Good puzzling and versatile mechanics! Loved it!

35606934.review: Un très bon Puzzle game. C'est à la sauce Poly Bridge de toutes évidences, mais les différents modes lui donne suffisement d'originalité pour justifié l'achat.

35606117.review:
You could say I'm getting "Carried Away" with this game... which I am, I'm playing way too much of it to be productive.

It's one of the best physics puzzlers I can think of. Every finish is super satisfying. You don't dread starting the simulation because you are able to predict what's going to happen. Because it's built around ski lifts each level is completely different, it's not just about building a tower on every level. There's even different kinds of levels that challenge different thing such as a drag level where the idea is to keep the towline close to the ground or a normal ski level where you have to make a jump. There are near infinite ways to tackle many of the levels and much of the fun comes from finding a new way of building. 

As for the visuals, they're fantastic. The models are clean low-poly that really shine from the lighting. It's a fantastic art style.


I should note that I experienced one bug where I couldn't place any structural elements. I reset the game and it was solved and I haven't had any problems with the game since. For 7 hours in an early access game that's really good. 

So yeah, if your thinking of buying the game I would say pick it up. The community is small right now but that's actually a good thing because you have a chance of making the leaderboard on every level. (I'm number 1 on drag queen.) With workshop connection and more development I don't think you could get tired of the game. Just don't get carried away.

35604271.review:
Despite me having played the game for only over an hour I have to say that it is gorgeous. And even though it is still an Early Access game it is polished, the levels are challenging, and graphics is beautiful. So far from what I have played and seen in videos it does not have any major bugs and glitches. It is ver pleasing to watch your lifts work as they are supposed to but alo very challenging sometimes. Overall I would totally recomend this game even in Early Access because it is a lot of fun.

Here is my playthrough which if you like, please subscribe and drop a like for more :). It helps a bunch:
https://youtu.be/LBmvyGJm6n8

35603648.review: Such a relaxing and calm game. A great way to spend time! I think the devs did a great job and I hope they continue!

35602928.review: This is an awesome game that will entertain you for hours and hours on end. It is basically a bridge building game with a cool twist. The developers are very in touch with the audience, which for me completes the whole experience! This is one of my favourite games, because you can do so many things in it like designing your own levels, completing other people's ones in the Steam Workshop, beating your friend's scores, and much more. I would really recommend this game if you like bridge building games.

35602806.review: I really love this game, I would recommend it to pretty much everyone because its easy to master, its very calming, and a heck alot of fun! I play this game almost ever day because its just so fun and I hope this game can become even bigger than what it is now!

35596852.review: Really fun and relaxing game! The controls are intuitive, bulding and pulling works like a charm. I also love the graphics, really well made and totally fitting for the game mechanics. You have the ability to grow with the game and build more and more complex lifts and ramps. clear purchase recommendation!

35594935.review:
I love it! The price really attracted me to buy this game and I wondered if it was a case of "you get what you pay for". In this instance I can say I got a lot of bang for my buck. The tutorial helped me to understand the slight differences in controls to other games of this type but they are very user friendly and after a few minutes I managed to get to grips with all the hotkey solutions as well.

The learning curve is not too slow so each level offers a new challenge and as you progress the challenge continues to grow as well (3 hours can easily feel like 10 minutes with this one!)

I complete each level and try to earn every medal and collect the stars. Possibly the most fun part is afer that when I'm trying to top the leader board by getting the skiers across the level with the least expensive construction (where the fate of the skiers is usually death). Crashing and burning, what's not to love!

I was very pleasently surprised when I found there was an element of this game with ski jumps/ramps and going down the mountains as well. I am confident that the developers are all keen riders themselves as they use button/drag lifts, gondolas and a really cool feature is the piste map in between levels, that way you are always immersed in the mountains.

I wanted to leave a review because I have seen youtube videos that have told me this is the developers first game and I think they've done a fantastic job considering this is early release, I'm sure others will agree it is a great package and I am excited to see what more will come it has so much potential for new features.

I spent a few miuntes in the sandbox mode and I think it will really keep me coming back time and time again. I am a big fan of the feature, it feels like the dev's have told us "These are our puzzles, can you do any better?" It is super easy to shape the mountains and valleys yourself and the pre-designed levels have given me some good inspiration of the different challenges you can try and create.

Overall, very pleased with the purchase, the game could be twice the price and it wouldn't feel unreasonable at all.

I would happily reccommend to anyone that likes a construction/physics/puzzle game.

See you on the slopes!

35583453.review:
Carried Away is a physic based game where you build ski lifts, jumps and bridges just to bring Skiers from one point to another.

It has a nice tutorial to begin with so we can learn the UI and important keys. It has various levels to play with and challenge yourself to earn all the objective and earn the achievements. It's not demanding on your system. You have level editor to mess with. It's a simple and enjoyable game.

Here's 30 minutes of gameplay if you're interested: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aINkVR83F3Y&feature=youtu.be

35538583.review:
やはりスキーリフトとあっては普通の橋では思いもしなかった壊れ方・ハプニングが起きるものですね…

[h1]おすすめポイント[/h1]
[list]
  [*] EAなのにすでに日本語対応
  [*] カメラの自由度が高い
  [*] リフトのケーブルの自由度が高い
  [*] サンドボックスの地形の自由度が高い
  [*] 慣れれば便利な建設操作
  [*] [b]再生中に壊れた場所をハイライトしてくれる[/b]
  [*] 一部ステージでスキーヤーを操作できる
  [*] ローポリな世界観に上手くマッチしたライティング
  [*] いいBGM
[/list]

[h1]現時点でちょっと気になるポイント[/h1]
[list]
  [*] ゲーム終了が割りと重い
  [*] 再生・編集を繰り返すと稀にフレーム落ちする
[/list]

スキーリフトといえば座るタイプを思い浮かべるかもしれませんが、
このゲームではドラッグリフト([url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surface_lift]Wikipedia英語版[/url])も作れます。
あと、やはりと言うか、[b]おなじみの[/b]ジャンプ台も健在です。

橋ゲー各種を楽しめる人には間違いなくおすすめできるのがこのCarried Awayですね。

35529065.review: I am a huge fan of bridge-building type physics based games.  Carried Away literally turns that upside down.  Building ski-lifts is similar, yet completely challenging.  I've been challenged more times than I care to admit.  There is a nice change of pace with downhill-skier missions just to break things up.  The graphics are simple, yet adorable, and completely appropriate to this style of game.  If you are looking for a good challenge, this is it!

35525379.review: The comparison has been made before, but it's a good one so I'll make it again: Carried Away is like Poly Bridge but with Ski Lifts. This game also has a few tricks of it's own, including varied level goals and controllable skiers, so it succeeds in presenting an enjoyable new challenge that never feels like a rehash of a different game. Although I haven't finished it yet, it does seem quite difficult, and some levels feel impossible at first due to how weak the materials are. In the end, when you do finish a level, it offers a very rewarding sense of achievement from overcoming what you thought you never could. I still wouldn't even consider riding on one of the ski lifts I built in this game, though.

35523252.review: for polly bridge fans is this a great game and its very unique. having said that i am more into rollercoaster tycoon and that type of stuff and this sadly just doesnt fit in but its still a great game with a nice artstyle and good controls so if you liked polly bridge you will like this game

35521216.review: It's similar to Poly Bridge only that you are on the mountains and building ski lifts, I recommend it

35518741.review: Ne respecte en rien la physique , on s'acharne pour poser 4 bouts de planche et une poutre avec une corde pour faire un télésiège , j'ai mis 9€ à la poubelle .

35499870.review: Very Fun and challenging. Can't wait for more levels

35494316.review:
Such a fun game and really nicely designed!

I've played plenty of these design/engineering type games and this is by far my favourite, the skiing aspect really sets it apart from similar games, and I love being able to look around the map for those nice visuals.

Although I've only played this for a short period I have already really enjoyed it. Sometimes these games can be monotonous, but the variation in levels and scenery is great, and I can't wait to see new aspects develop.

The sandbox element of the game is also really fun, being able to create and upload levels to test your friends is a great feature.

Would definitely recommend this to anyone.

35493666.review: C первых минут игра начинает затягивать. Игр с подобным жанром много, но это не сравнится с постройкой мостов и т.п. Советую всем поиграть!

35492368.review:
A cool game about building ski lifts in the vein of Bridge Builder.
The controls are slick, the skiers are cute and there is a decent amount of variety. You build chair lifts, drag lifts, gondolas. But there are also levels where you have to build bridges and jumps (and control the skiers directly).
The controls are super slick and intuitive. Only the UI has a few quirks.
There is also a powerful level editor with workshop support.

More details and gameplay: https://gaming.youtube.com/watch?v=0AHVkvl-04g

35486840.review: If theres one thing that makes this game stand out from most structure building games, is the fact you interact with the game in more than one way (you build the ski lift, build jumps for the skiers and also you can control the skiers) making it more challenging all the while it being relaxing. I totally recommend this if youre interested in relaxing building puzzle games. Can't wait to see more!

35486438.review: The game is fun, challenging and the music is great.

35485831.review:
So after a few more hours of playing ive decided to change my review, biggest thing was the grid combinded with the line limit things made the game feel un precice and was frustrating trying to get the position i wanted. but once the game told me i could turn the gird off it was much better.

i really like the lift builds its what i expected, but i really dont like the ski jumps and the fact you can sort of control them it produces some random events, say you build a ramp that works with no input then you need to jump to get the star, rip your bridge.

a better implimentation of the jumps and supports could have been to build bridges for the drag lifts which i have played one already and was a fun challenge

one thing that is really anoying me at the moment is the 3d towers you make for the lifts, why are they so far to the side with a giant pole sticking out for the wheel it would imply you need to worry about torque but you dont its just and illusion...

also why can i build more than 1 connection between the same two points... the amount of times ive clicked in the middle of a connection only for it to add a new connection on top of the old one rater than replacing it...

35478282.review:
Got the game as part of the alpha testing team.

This game takes the 'bridge constructor' to a different level (altitude). Use ropes, logs and ramps to build skilifts and bring your skiers safely to the mountain top so they can enjoy their well deserved winter vacation :D

35478037.review: This is the most inventive engineering game I've played. While the concept isn't entirely new, with plenty of similar bridge-building games already available, this is the first I've seen a different take on it, and it really works. The art style is lovely and when you come out of building mode you can view your structure in 3D, which is very unique. Simple yet fun!

35475623.review: As a translator of the game I have played the game several games now. I can say it's defienetly definitely one of the best physic games out there. Also the community is really nice.

35475572.review:
Симулятор горнолыжных курортов. Любителям разнообразных симуляторов игра очень понравится, так как сделана качественно, красиво и хорошей оптимизацией.

В игре 2 режима:

- Каръера - сдесь вам нужно будет из новичка строителя стать професионалом в построении горнолыжных курортов. Инструментов для строительства более, чем достаточно. Строить будем от легких конструкций из досок, до прочных из бревен и канатов. По мимо подемников так же нужно будет построить и спуски с транплинами и т.д. Я еще в данной игре вы сможете не только постороить но и сами опробовать свои творения управляя лыжником! Реализовано качественное и понятное обучение, на многих языках, в том числе и на русском.

- Песочнича - в данном режиме вам будет доступна полная свобода действий.

Еще в игре присутствует мастерская Steam, из которой вам будут доступны работы игроков со всего мира и вы сами сможете загрузить свои работы, если считаете нужным показать свое твоение.

Игра хоть и в раннем доступе, но я этого не заметил, так как работает она на "Ура", да и практически все режимы игры и функции в рабочем состоянии :)

35475311.review:
Carried Away is a physics based sandbox game developed by Huge Calf Studios. Your goal is to build a safe ski lifts, jumps or bridges for skiers to safely pass. Game also allows to make your own level.

There are 3 types of game modes. First, there is campaign. There are 3 worlds (Tutorial world excluded), and each world has 14 levels. So there are plenty of levels, and you can be certain that each level is uniqe and non-repetitive.

Second, there is the Sandbox mode. As i mentioned before, you can make your own level and share it with other players via Workshop.

Third and last, is the Workshop. You can download levels made by other players and play them.

If you’re looking for something to chill while you play, Carried Away would be perfect for you. You can listen some musics while you play (By the way, Carried Away’s soundtrack is also very chill)

I also have a curator page and review games on there. Would be grateful if you could take a look at it 
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/akusarireview#curation

35475244.review:
[h1]A slick physics puzzler with campaign, sandbox mode and workshop support. Admire your handiwork in 3D and watch your intrepid skiers reach the top or perish in horrific accidents! This is why Health and Safety is a thing.[/h1]

You create your lift towers on a 2D screen using a selection of materials (planks, logs, supports, wheels etc) and then drag the cable over the wheels to the fixing point at the top of the hill and click Play. The screen switches to 3D view and you can spin it around, drag it and zoom in and out to watch as your skiers jump on the lift to hopefully get to the other end without the whole thing collapsing.

One of the best things about this game is the way the tolerance of each building item changes colour during the animation according to how much stress it's under. You can watch an entire tower as it turns yellow and orange on one side and stays green on the other, so you can visualise where the strengths and weaknesses are. After it collapses and you're back in 2D view, the struts that broke are shown in red, so you can see exactly where your breaking point was and do something about it. Ingenious.

Success is measured by four factors:

1. Whether or not all skiers made it safely - sometimes some of them make it but others don't.

2. Whether everything was still intact at the end. It's possible (and common) to transport enough skiers to complete the level just before it all collapses.

3. Whether you picked up the bonus blue stars along the way.

4. Whether you were within budget. You're allowed a set amount of cash to use on each project.

On some levels you get to control the skier as he attempts to fling himself at your ski jumps. You can crouch/stand to get better take-off and if you're clever you can do backflips. It's way cool.

At the end of a successful level you can see where you are on the leaderboard, which is ranked according to how much cash you spent to complete the level, so it's always important to use as few materials as you can to make the most efficient solution.

[h1]Sound & Vision[/h1]

There's cheery, relaxing 'elevator music' that changes now and then, and never becomes annoying. A nice accompaniment while you work. The 2D working view while you build your system allows you to drag the screen around and zoom in and out so you can focus on each part of your construction. You can switch between 2D and 3D any time, and in 3D you have total freedom of your camera to zoom, pan, rotate to get the best view of your bloodbath... I mean happy skiers on their way to their next run.

[h1]Steam[/h1]

The devs have made good use of all the Steam options here. There's achievements, Leaderboards and Workshop/Level editor. No Steam Cloud mentioned and I think they need to set this up, it's especially useful for dual-booters like me. Win and Mac are officially supported and I happen to know that Linux is on the way because Jonny asked me to test it for him.

[h1]Difficulty[/h1]

The first mountain area (of 3, and more on the way) is quite easy, and gets you into the swing of using the various materials available. After that it starts becoming very challenging and there's a big sense of victory when you succeed. You will see your carefully constructed masterpieces collapse and crumble many times before you reach that point though. If you're easily frustrated, give this a miss.

[h1]Value[/h1]

When I'm writing reviews before the release date I like to play a little game with myself and guess the price. I said US$10 for this so I wasn't far off. You won't be disappointed if you pay full price, the leaderboards and workshop will give you as much replay value as you can handle, and the overall quality is top notch.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

The only other game of this type I've played is World Of Goo so I'm not sure how this compares against the several other bridge building games around these days, but I must say that Carried Away is a very satisfying puzzler in general terms. Easy to learn, hard to master, with great 3D graphics and best of all the in-game currency is good old £££Pounds Sterling£££.

If you're wondering about the Early Access and whether to wait until later, my advice is don't worry because this is already a great, fully functional, bug-free game as far as I can tell. They're going to add a lot more stuff later but go ahead and play it now, you won't regret it.

[quote]More reviews at SaveOrQuit.com[/quote]

35475123.review:
Классная, забавная, расслабляющая игра. В ней есть кампания с разнообразными уровнями. Каждый уровень имеет свою таблицу лидеров, попробуйте оказаться на вершине рейтинга =) Также вы можете создавать свои уровни и делиться ими с друзьями или со всем миром. Игра в стиле "bridge builder". Мне понравилась фишка со свободной камерой, где можно рассмотреть все что угодно. Есть возможность поставить симуляцию на паузу или изменить ее скорость. Не смотря на то что игра вышла в раннем доступе, в ней уже достаточно контента для многих часов наслаждения! И впереди в планах разработчиков много интересного. Игру, кстати, делают всего три человека, если не ошибаюсь.
В общем, если вам нравится такой жанр игр и вам хочется развееться от жары, направившись в снежные горы - то это игра то что надо!
